title: Polarizing Philippines leader invited to White House
description: President Donald Trump invited his polarizing Philippines counterpart to the White House during a phone call in which the two leaders discussed North Korea.

title: Trump: I'd meet Kim Jong Un under 'right circumstances'
description: President Donald Trump said Monday he would be willing to meet with North Korean leader Kim Jong Un "under the right circumstances" to defuse tensions over North Korea's nuclear program.

title: Human Rights Watch slams Trump for Duterte invite
description: Ivan Watson speaks with Phil Robertson from Human Rights Watch about Donald Trump's controversial move to invite the Philippine leader to the White House

title: Duterte: I'd eat a terrorist's liver
description: Philippine President Rodrigo Duterte is known for boasting about outrageous violence, but on Monday he went full Hannibal Lecter.

title: May Day protests, celebrations around the globe
description: May Day is a time to celebrate workers around the world and the gains made by labor advocates, but it's also a time when police are on high alert as the gatherings in many cities are known to get violent.

title: What is May Day, anyway?
description: To most people in the Northern Hemisphere, May Day conjures images of brightly colored twirling ribbons and promises of warm days ahead. That's not the whole story, though: May Day is also a day of protests and riots that traces its modern roots back to a world-changing explosion in Chicago.

title: Hamas presents new policy document
description: [Breaking news update at 2:54 p.m. ET]

title: Trump's wacky history lessons continue
description: After puzzling comments about 19th Century abolitionist Frederick Douglass and marveling that no one knew Abraham Lincoln was a Republican, President Donald Trump has just unloaded another historical non sequitur.

title: Mystery illness claims 12 lives in Liberia
description: An unexplained illness has claimed the lives of 12 people in Liberia since April 23, the World Health Organization reported Monday. Twenty-one people have fallen ill, including an unknown number of children, and three remain hospitalized at Francis Grant Hospital in Sinoe County.

title: 'Blood on the ceiling': Dozens injured after flight turbulence
description: At least 27 passengers were injured when an Aeroflot flight from Moscow to Bangkok hit severe air turbulence on Monday.

title: TV exec gunned down in Istanbul
description: A prominent Iranian TV executive and his Kuwaiti business partner were gunned down in the Turkish city of Istanbul late Saturday night.

title: Good neighbors: Saving China's forgotten tulous
description: Looking like a Roman coliseum crossed with a doughnut, China's tulou buildings are some of the most stunning -- and threatened -- structures in the country.

title: Cuban plane crash kills 8 troops, military says
description: A plane carrying eight members of the Cuban military crashed Saturday morning in a mountainous part of the island, the military said through state media. Everyone on board was killed, the Ministry of the Revolutionary Armed Forces announced, according to Granma.

title: US service member killed near Mosul
description: A US service member died from wounds suffered in an explosive device blast on Saturday outside of Mosul, Iraq, according to a statement from the anti-ISIS coalition.

title: North Korea's missile test fails, US military says
description: A ballistic missile launched early Saturday by North Korea in defiance of international pressure and at a time of heightened regional tensions appears to have failed.

title: Turkey blocks Wikipedia over what it calls terror 'smear campaign'
description: Turkey has blocked access to Wikipedia over linking the nation to terror activity, the government said Saturday, according to state-run Anadolu Agency.

title: Pope: Humanity couldn't bear war with North Korea
description: Pope Francis said Saturday he worries that rising tensions between the United States and North Korea could lead to a wide military conflict that would wipe out a "large part of humanity."

title: US Marines return to volatile Afghan province
description: The US Marines are back in Afghanistan's turbulent Helmand province for the first time since the NATO-led international coalition ended its combat operations three years ago.

title: Uber's CEO is gambling with his company's future
description: In American business, it has long been argued that crime doesn't pay, but bad behavior often does. That may be changing -- and fast. Just ask Travis Kalanick, CEO of Uber, who The New York Times recently described as a businessman willing to win at any cost.

title: Trump just gave two bizarre (and fact-free) interviews
description: To commemorate his 100th day in office -- a "ridiculous" marker created by the "fake news" media! -- President Donald Trump gave a series of long interviews to a variety of news outlets. And, holy cow did he talk -- and talk.

title: Macron can still blow the French election
description: Emmanuel Macron may well become the next president of France, but he's not making it any easier for the French to vote for him.

title: US manufacturing grows for 8th straight month
SpaceX launches secretive spy satellite
Saudis take 100% control of America's largest oil refinery
Homeless at 14, she's saving kids from the streets
description: When she was 14 years old, Mariuma Ben Yosef ran away from home.

title: North Korea's missile test fails, US military says
description: A ballistic missile launched early Saturday by North Korea in defiance of international pressure and at a time of heightened regional tensions appears to have failed.

title: Turkey blocks Wikipedia over what it calls terror 'smear campaign'
description: Turkey has blocked access to Wikipedia over linking the nation to terror activity, the government said Saturday, according to state-run Anadolu Agency.

title: Pope: Humanity couldn't bear war with North Korea
description: Pope Francis said Saturday he worries that rising tensions between the United States and North Korea could lead to a wide military conflict that would wipe out a "large part of humanity."

title: US Marines return to volatile Afghan province
description: The US Marines are back in Afghanistan's turbulent Helmand province for the first time since the NATO-led international coalition ended its combat operations three years ago.

title: Uber's CEO is gambling with his company's future
description: In American business, it has long been argued that crime doesn't pay, but bad behavior often does. That may be changing -- and fast. Just ask Travis Kalanick, CEO of Uber, who The New York Times recently described as a businessman willing to win at any cost.

title: Trump just gave two bizarre (and fact-free) interviews
description: To commemorate his 100th day in office -- a "ridiculous" marker created by the "fake news" media! -- President Donald Trump gave a series of long interviews to a variety of news outlets. And, holy cow did he talk -- and talk.

title: Macron can still blow the French election
description: Emmanuel Macron may well become the next president of France, but he's not making it any easier for the French to vote for him.

title: US manufacturing grows for 8th straight month
SpaceX launches secretive spy satellite
Saudis take 100% control of America's largest oil refinery
Homeless at 14, she's saving kids from the streets
description: When she was 14 years old, Mariuma Ben Yosef ran away from home.

title: Who is your hero?
description: How does CNN Heroes find everyday people changing the world? With your help! Meet some of the nominators who got to make their hero a CNN Hero.

title: Recognize someone you admire
Polarizing Philippines leader invited to White House
description: President Donald Trump invited his polarizing Philippines counterpart to the White House during a phone call in which the two leaders discussed North Korea.

title: Trump: I'd meet Kim Jong Un under 'right circumstances'
description: President Donald Trump said Monday he would be willing to meet with North Korean leader Kim Jong Un "under the right circumstances" to defuse tensions over North Korea's nuclear program.

title: Human Rights Watch slams Trump for Duterte invite
description: Ivan Watson speaks with Phil Robertson from Human Rights Watch about Donald Trump's controversial move to invite the Philippine leader to the White House

title: Duterte: I'd eat a terrorist's liver
description: Philippine President Rodrigo Duterte is known for boasting about outrageous violence, but on Monday he went full Hannibal Lecter.

title: May Day protests, celebrations around the globe
description: May Day is a time to celebrate workers around the world and the gains made by labor advocates, but it's also a time when police are on high alert as the gatherings in many cities are known to get violent.

title: What is May Day, anyway?
description: To most people in the Northern Hemisphere, May Day conjures images of brightly colored twirling ribbons and promises of warm days ahead. That's not the whole story, though: May Day is also a day of protests and riots that traces its modern roots back to a world-changing explosion in Chicago.

title: Hamas presents new policy document
description: [Breaking news update at 2:54 p.m. ET]

title: Trump's wacky history lessons continue
description: After puzzling comments about 19th Century abolitionist Frederick Douglass and marveling that no one knew Abraham Lincoln was a Republican, President Donald Trump has just unloaded another historical non sequitur.

title: Mystery illness claims 12 lives in Liberia
description: An unexplained illness has claimed the lives of 12 people in Liberia since April 23, the World Health Organization reported Monday. Twenty-one people have fallen ill, including an unknown number of children, and three remain hospitalized at Francis Grant Hospital in Sinoe County.

title: 'Blood on the ceiling': Dozens injured after flight turbulence
description: At least 27 passengers were injured when an Aeroflot flight from Moscow to Bangkok hit severe air turbulence on Monday.

description: Philippine President Rodrigo Duterte is known for boasting about outrageous violence, but on Monday he went full Hannibal Lecter.

title: May Day protests, celebrations around the globe
description: May Day is a time to celebrate workers around the world and the gains made by labor advocates, but it's also a time when police are on high alert as the gatherings in many cities are known to get violent.

title: What is May Day, anyway?
description: To most people in the Northern Hemisphere, May Day conjures images of brightly colored twirling ribbons and promises of warm days ahead. That's not the whole story, though: May Day is also a day of protests and riots that traces its modern roots back to a world-changing explosion in Chicago.

title: Trump's wacky history lessons continue
description: After puzzling comments about 19th Century abolitionist Frederick Douglass and marveling that no one knew Abraham Lincoln was a Republican, President Donald Trump has just unloaded another historical non sequitur.

title: Mystery illness claims 12 lives in Liberia
description: An unexplained illness has claimed the lives of 12 people in Liberia since April 23, the World Health Organization reported Monday. Twenty-one people have fallen ill, including an unknown number of children, and three remain hospitalized at Francis Grant Hospital in Sinoe County.

description: At least 27 passengers were injured when an Aeroflot flight from Moscow to Bangkok hit severe air turbulence on Monday.

description: A plane carrying eight members of the Cuban military crashed Saturday morning in a mountainous part of the island, the military said through state media. Everyone on board was killed, the Ministry of the Revolutionary Armed Forces announced, according to Granma.

description: A US service member died from wounds suffered in an explosive device blast on Saturday outside of Mosul, Iraq, according to a statement from the anti-ISIS coalition.

description: Pope Francis said Saturday he worries that rising tensions between the United States and North Korea could lead to a wide military conflict that would wipe out a "large part of humanity."

description: The US Marines are back in Afghanistan's turbulent Helmand province for the first time since the NATO-led international coalition ended its combat operations three years ago.

description: CNN has visited North Korea many times in recent years. Here are some of the images captured by our journalists as they reported on life under Kim Jong Un.

description: The train speeds out of the darkness of the channel tunnel, emerging into a landscape of high security fences and barbed wire. Welcome to France.

description: Four men convicted of a gang rape that shocked India and attracted worldwide attention will be executed.

description: The British political party that precipitated the cataclysmic Brexit vote is on course for a wipeout at the first major electoral test since the referendum.

description: All eyes may be on the final round of the French presidential election this weekend, but tensions were running high in a sports hall in the north-east of England Friday.

description: In the south of France, heartland of far-right presidential candidate Marine Le Pen, a small community is sending a defiant message.

description: A South African start-up will next month begin mass producing a $30 smartphone, which it describes as the first of its kind to be manufactured in Africa.

description: In rural Brazil, an outbreak of yellow fever that began in December is considered the largest in 14 years.

title: Diabetes can't stop you from climbing Everest
description: I made the most important decision of my life because of diabetes.

description: Barely a month after Kendall Jenner appeared in a Pepsi commercial that drew such a concerted backlash that it was withdrawn, she's again at the center of controversy.

title: South Korea's all-singing, all-dancing K-pop politics
description: Its northern neighbor is engaged in nuclear brinkmanship with the US. Its elected President was just impeached and indicted on corruption charges, leaving behind a gaping power vacuum. And the economy is slowing down, leaving the country's highly-educated youth struggling with unemployment.

title: Is pizza healthy?
description: Pizza is healthy. And it isn't healthy.

title: What not to do on Cinco de Mayo
description: Time to pass the margarita pitcher? For most Americans, Cinco de Mayo calls to mind tequila shots, mariachi music, and special promotions at Mexican restaurants. The Fifth of May usually means that it's time for a mid-week fiesta.

title: The truth about Prince Philip's 'gaffes'
description: It shouldn't be that surprising that Prince Philip is retiring from royal duties this autumn, as Buckingham Palace has announced. After all, he's 96 next month -- 30 years older than retirement age for most of us.
